p: In adjusted analyses, the evidence that older MSM/TG were more likely to be virally suppressed remained (aPR = 1.03, 96% CI 1.00–1.06), while the statistical evidence for neighbourhood associations weakened somewhat (p = 0.070). The association between viral suppression and recreational drug use also weakened (aPR = 1.36, 95% CI 0.89–2.06, p = 0.155). Strong evidence that MSM who had bought sex were more likely to virally suppressed remained, though the strength of the association reduced somewhat (aPR = 1.53, 95% CI 1.12–2.08).
